text:
Created attachment 30712
Test Plan Demonstrating Behavior

Using fifoPut in a BeanShell Sampler shows fifoSize of 1, where the same exact BeanShell script inside a BeanShell Post-Processor shows fifoSize of 2.

Print statements in the BeanShell Post-Processor are only executed once, but it seems as though the fifoPut is executed twice.

The attached .jmx test plan has two thread groups, one that works with a BeanShell Sampler, and one that fails with a BeanShell Post-Processor.  Both BeanShell elements contain the exact same statements.

Test outputs to CMD prompt.  Sample output can be seen below:

- - - - - - - WORKING TEST - - - - - - -
Queue size is 1 (Expected value of 1)
..... After Ask Question.....
Queue size is 0 (Expected value of 0)
- - - - - - - END WORKING TEST - - - - - - -


- - - - - - - NOT WORKING TEST  - - - - - - -
Queue size is 2 (Expected value of 1)
..... After Ask Question.....
Queue size is 1 (Expected value of 0)
- - - - - - - END NOT WORKING TEST - - - - - - -


Is this a bug, or is this BeanShell Post-Processor implementation incorrect?

-Aaron
creator: Aaron.Davidovits@Pearson.com
sebb@apache.org
text: Test Plan won't load. Appears to contain 3rd party plugins.

Hi Sebb - Thank you for the swift reply.

This does indeed require JMeter plugins for the Inter-Thread communicator aspect.

Consequently, should this bug/incident be reported elsewhere or we can continue to address it here?

-Aaron
creator: Aaron.Davidovits@Pearson.com

text:
If you can show a bug with JMeter itself, then report it here.
I.e. if you can show the problem without using any external plugins then attach a new test case here.

Problems that involve 3rd party plugins must be addressed to the provider.
creator: sebb@apache.org
Aaron.Davidovits@Pearson.com
text:
Understood - Thank you for the feedback Sebb, it is much appreciated.

-Aaron
